title: Visitors Flock To Sniff Flower That Smells Like Rotting Corpse ready
description: A very rare and very stinky plant, known commonly as the corpse flower, drew long lines at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden as locals sought to get a whiff, with the bloom occurring for the first time since it arrived in 2018 and only lasting a few days before it collapses. What do you think? The post Visitors Flock To Sniff Flower That Smells Like Rotting Corpse ready appeared first on The Onion.
author: The Onion Staff
excerpt: A very rare and very stinky plant, known commonly as the corpse flower, drew long lines at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden as locals sought to get a whiff, with the bloom occurring for the first time since it arrived in 2018 and only lasting a few days before it collapses. What do you think?
text: A very rare and very stinky plant, known commonly as the corpse flower, drew long lines at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden as locals sought to get a whiff, with the bloom occurring for the first time since it arrived in 2018 and only lasting a few days before it collapses. What do you think? “What else does a plant have to do to tell people it wants to be left alone?” Robbie McRae, Systems Analyst “I never pass up an opportunity to stand in a line.” Fred Akers, Merchandise Critic “What a great place to hide a corpse.” Lori Seegers, Pastry Historian
html:
A very rare and very stinky plant, known commonly as the corpse flower, drew long lines at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden as locals sought to get a whiff, with the bloom occurring for the first time since it arrived in 2018 and only lasting a few days before it collapses. What do you think?

“What else does a plant have to do to tell people it wants to be left alone?”

Robbie McRae, Systems Analyst

“I never pass up an opportunity to stand in a line.”

Fred Akers, Merchandise Critic

“What a great place to hide a corpse.”

Lori Seegers, Pastry Historian
